CLONIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Unlicensed use
  • Treatment cessation
  • Less suitable for prescribing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Hypertension,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 50–100 micrograms 3 times a day, increase initial dose every second or third day, usual maximum dose 1.2 mg daily.

Prevention of recurrent migraine, Prevention of vascular headache,

By mouth

  • For adults
    Initially 50 micrograms twice daily for 2 weeks, then increased if necessary to 75 micrograms twice daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

May lower fetal heart rate. Avoid oral use unless potential benefit outweighs risk. Avoid using injection.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution in severe impairment—reduce initial dose and increase gradually.

Contra indications

  • Severe bradyarrhythmia secondary to second- or third-degree AV block or sick sinus syndrome

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Constipation, depression, dizziness, drowsiness, dry mouth, headache, malaise, nausea, postural hypotension, salivary gland pain, sexual dysfunction, sleep disturbances, vomiting,

uncommon: Bradycardia, delusion, hallucination, paraesthesia, pruritus, rash, Raynaud’s syndrome, urticaria,

rare: Alopecia, AV block, colonic pseudo-obstruction, decreased lacrimation, gynaecomastia, nasal dryness,

notKnown: Bradyarrhythmia, confusion, fluid retention, hepatitis, impaired visual accommodation,

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • Cerebrovascular disease
  • constipation
  • heart failure
  • history of depression
  • mild to moderate bradyarrhythmia
  • polyneuropathy
  • Raynaud’s syndrome or other occlusive peripheral vascular disease

Unlicensed use

Clonidine may also be used for Tourette syndrome and sedation—unlicensed indications.

Advice regarding ceasing treatment

In hypertension, must be withdrawn gradually to avoid severe rebound hypertension.

Conditions when less suitable for prescribing

Clonidine is less suitable for prescribing.

Prepared medicinal forms of CLONIDINE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: solution for injection, oral suspension, solution for infusion, oral solution, transdermal patch,
Tablet
Solution for injection
